comment._content: From one who's been there, holiday mail when deployed is always the best.

comment.author: 20634999@N04
comment._content: God Bless The Troops that have maded it possible for so many to worship freely arouind the world and to be able to enjoy Christmas 2008!

comment.author: 30292623@N04
comment._content: When I flew to Saudi for Desert Storm, I had a lost bag, the people at the Air Terminal, told me to look through this big room of Bags, I found 3 mail bags.  When I brought them to the desk they said "How are we suppose to know where they go?"  I pointed out to them the big red bag with "US Mail" on it gave it away....

comment.author: 22386228@N08
comment._content: great photo chronicling a piece of history

comment.author: 21389193@N00
comment._content:
The package marked "Glass, With Care" is somewhat smashed, while the other packages look mostly pristine.

Some things never change.

comment.author: 24829762@N00
comment._content:
Stieglitzz:  >>>>The generosity of the American people is unsurpassed in the world<<<<<<<<

I agree American people are very generous but I think  the mountains of mail in WWII was caused more by parents and sweethearts than the public/organizations  at large. Remember there were  12 000 000 of us under  arms. 

That is 24 000000  "senders" counting just parents-no sweethearts or wives,sisters, brothers. "Everybody" it seemed (not quite) was in uniform.

 I was in the Pacific theatre and mail took as long as 30-60 days to reach us. Sometimes longer.

comment.author: 96029623@N00
comment._content: It was also a time when the dimutive postal service was severly restricted due to worker shortages and in some instances protests. It was, I think , the first time the military intervened to assist in delivery. Having lived through that period I can relate to the confusion and over whhelming volumn of presents, gifts and other offers of assistence. A wonderful time in American history when all pulled together for a common cause. Wonderful depiction. I just wonder if this was an APO.
